title: Textile, 16th–early 17th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft (?)
description: Red plain weave center brocaded in a detached flower design in gold, green, and white silks. Pattern arranged in horizontal rows. Trimmed with a wide band of gray-green silk twill stamped in a diagonal design and brocaded in a small flower pattern in white, rose and green silks. At corners, square insertion of red silk brocaded in small cone design in gold. Trimmed with pink and green piping and lined with pink taffeta.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 16th–early 17th century.Medium: silk
Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft (?). 1966-30-2.
